intro: Heliohebe, commonly known as the sunflower of the south, is a genus of flowering plants native to New Zealand. These plants are part of the Campanulaceae family and are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Heliohebe species typically grow in rocky or gravelly soils and thrive in sunny conditions. They are often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where they contribute to the unique flora of the Southern Hemisphere. The genus includes several species, each with distinct foliage and floral characteristics.
